Description: Lip and body sherd of Chian pottery Ionian cup with everted rim; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black; at top of wall worn added red band lined in white; exterior: rim glazed (top lost); trace of myrtle wreath in white; handle zone reserved with dilute line at top; glazed below; graffito in handle zone.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.400, 1924,1201.188, Oxford AN1925.608e(3) and Boston MFA 1888.1081. For parallels regarding Ionian cups with myrtle wreaths, see British Museum 1888,0601.271 and 1924,1201.1280, both are from Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1906) (phase 2)
